docs.snippet: A cooperative effort by nations to plan their economies so as to avoid conflict in international trade will he put to the test for the first time in Latin America in the coming decade, according to a program already taking shape in South America.
docs.lead_paragraph: A cooperative effort by nations to plan their economies so as to avoid conflict in international trade will he put to the test for the first time in Latin America in the coming decade, according to a program already taking shape in South America.

headline.main: Latin America Plans to Test Theory on International Trade; Program Calls for Each Nation to Produce Goods for Which It Is Best Suited and to Have Clear Field in Sales

docs.snippet: Twenty naval chiefs and officers from eleven Latin-American nations will begin a three-week air tour of United States Navy bases on the Atlantic, Pacific and Gulf Coasts tomorrow from Miami, it was learned here yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Twenty naval chiefs and officers from eleven Latin-American nations will begin a three-week air tour of United States Navy bases on the Atlantic, Pacific and Gulf Coasts tomorrow from Miami, it was learned here yesterday.

headline.main: LATIN NAVY OFFICERS WILL TOUR U.S. BASES; 20 Leaders From 11 Nations to Begin Air Trip Tomorrow

docs.snippet: Except for the appearance of reports from Washington that the United States was studying the question of the general "freezing" of foreign funds in this country, there was little of interest in the fluctuations or business in the foreign currency...
docs.lead_paragraph: Except for the appearance of reports from Washington that the United States was studying the question of the general "freezing" of foreign funds in this country, there was little of interest in the fluctuations or business in the foreign currency market last week.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED MAY 3, 1941

docs.snippet: At the close of the current European war Latin America's industrial expansion should have reached the point where hundreds of American engineers, technicians of all kinds and plant foremen will be needed to supervise operations, Maurice Holland,...
docs.lead_paragraph: At the close of the current European war Latin America's industrial expansion should have reached the point where hundreds of American engineers, technicians of all kinds and plant foremen will be needed to supervise operations, Maurice Holland, managing director of the engineering and research division of the National Research Council, said yesterday.

headline.main: INDUSTRY EXPANDS IN SOUTH AMERICA; Needs Trained American Men, Maurice Holland Reports After Six Weeks' Tour SIX COUNTRIES STUDIED Research Council Official and Twenty Members Made Valuable Contacts

docs.snippet: On a good-will tour of the United States as guests of Admiral Harold R. Stark, Chief of Naval Operations, naval chiefs and officers of eleven American republics left Florida yesterday morning for Washington, where they will be presented to President...
docs.lead_paragraph: On a good-will tour of the United States as guests of Admiral Harold R. Stark, Chief of Naval Operations, naval chiefs and officers of eleven American republics left Florida yesterday morning for Washington, where they will be presented to President Roosevelt by their host on Thursday.

headline.main: LATIN NAVY CHIEFS START TOUR OF U.S.; Representatives of Eleven Republics Making Good-Will Visit as Stark's Guests ROOSEVELT TO BE HOST Later Party Will Spend Three Days Here -- Will Travel to West Coast by Plane
